contact

Class Contact

extends Person

    1.0.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • Contact

        public Contact(java.lang.String firstName,
               java.lang.String lastName,
               Gender gender,
               long DOB)
        Constructor accepts the first name, last name, gender and date of birth as parameters. Generates a unique identifier (entry number) for each contact. Gender is a string "Male" or "Female". Date of birth is represented using yyyymmdd format.
        Parameters:
        firstName - String representation of the contact's first name
        lastName - String representation of the contact's last name
        gender - String representation of gender. ("Male" or "Female")
        DOB - long representation of the contact's date of birth. Format: yyyymmdd

    • Method Detail

      • getEntryNo

        public int getEntryNo()
        Return the entry number for the contact. The entry number is automatically generated when the Contact object is created as a serial number (starting value 1).
        Returns:
        an integer representing the entry number of the contact

      • getAge

        public int getAge()
        Calculates and returns the contact’s age.
        Returns:
        an integer representation of the contact's age

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns contact's name in the form of "Brown, John"
        Overrides:
        getName in class Person
        Returns:
        A string with the contact's name

      • updateName

        public void updateName(java.lang.String name)
        Changes the last name of the contact
        Parameters:
        name - A string representing the new last name

      • setAlias

        public void setAlias(java.lang.String Newalias)
        Sets the contact’s alias and checks if the given alias already exist.
        Parameters:
        Newalias - a unique string id that represents the contact alias

      • getAlias

        public java.lang.String getAlias()
        Return the contact’s alias.
        Returns:
        a String containing the contact's alias

      • setAddress

        public void setAddress(java.lang.String address)
        Accepts a string with the parts of the address separated by semicolons
        Parameters:
        address - String with the contact's address separated by semicolons (see details on Address class).

      • getAddress

        public java.lang.String[] getAddress()
        Return an array containing the lines in an address not including blank lines. The last element in the array is the country.
        Returns:
        an array of strings representing the contact's address. The last element in the array is the country.

      • addEmail

        public void addEmail(java.lang.String email)
        Add an email address to a set of email address for the contact. Each contact can have an infinite number of email addresses.
        Parameters:
        email - a string representation a contact's email

      • deleteEmail

        public void deleteEmail(java.lang.String email)
        Delete the email address given as a parameter from the set of email addresses for the contact.
        Parameters:
        email - a string representation of the contact's email

      • getEmailList

        public java.lang.String[] getEmailList()
        Return an array of the email addresses for the contact.
        Returns:
        an array of all the contact's emails

      • addPhone

        public void addPhone(char type,
                     long number)
        Add a phone number to the list of phone numbers that the contact has. The method accepts two parameters. The first is for the type of number (H=Home, W=Work, M=Mobile). The second parameter is the phone number where the first three digits are the area code. For example, 8767024455. A contact can have up to 5 phone numbers.
        Parameters:
        type - character representing the type of number
        number - long representing the contact's phone number

      • deletePhone

        public void deletePhone(long number)
        Deletes the phone number given as a parameter from the list of phone numbers.
        Parameters:
        number - long representing the contact's phone numbers

      • getPhoneList

        public java.lang.String[] getPhoneList()
        Returns an array of strings representing the contact's phone numbers. Each phone number is formatted as specified by the toString method of the phone class
        Returns:
        a string array of phone list
